cards.name: Angelic Curator
cards.text: Flying, protection from artifacts
cards.flavor:
"Do not treat your people as you treat your artifacts. Let them go, and they will live; seal them here, and they will die."
—Urza, to Radiant
cards.original_text: Flying, protection from artifacts

cards.name: Blessed Reversal
cards.text: You gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.
cards.flavor: Even an enemy is a valuable resource.
cards.original_text: Gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.

rulings.text: The creatures are counted on resolution.

cards.name: Burst of Energy
cards.text: Untap target permanent.
cards.flavor:
"I stand ready to die for our world. Who will stand with me?"
—Radiant, archangel
cards.original_text: Untap target permanent.

cards.name: Cessation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack.
When Cessation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Cessation to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"The face of Light will shine upon them, and they will know war no more."
—Song of All, canto 918
cards.original_text:
Enchanted creature cannot attack.
When Cessation is put into a graveyard from play, return Cessation to owner's hand.

cards.name: Defender of Law
cards.text:
Flash
Protection from red
cards.flavor: "It is not my place to question Radiant's rule. I exist to enforce her will."
cards.original_text:
Protection from red
You may play Defender of Law any time you could play an instant.

rulings.text: This card is always a creature spell and is never an instant spell, no matter when you cast it.

cards.name: Devout Harpist
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a creature.
cards.flavor: The notes themselves are irrelevant. The music's effect, however, is worth ten armies.
cards.original_text: {T}: Destroy target creature enchantment.

rulings.text: It can only target "Enchantment - Aura" cards, which includes cards changed into Auras, such as Licids.

cards.name: Erase
cards.text: Exile target enchantment.
cards.flavor: Perception is more pleasing than truth.
cards.original_text: Remove target enchantment from the game.

rulings.text: The card does not go to the graveyard first.

cards.name: Expendable Troops
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Expendable Troops: It deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: No doubt in their minds, no fear in their hearts.
cards.original_text: {T}, Sacrifice Expendable Troops: Expendable Troops deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Hope and Glory
cards.text: Untap two target creatures. Each of them gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Serra ruled by faith. I cannot afford that luxury."
—Radiant, archangel
cards.original_text: Untap two target creatures. Each of them gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Must target two different creatures.

cards.name: Iron Will
cards.text:
Target creature gets +0/+4 until end of turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.original_text:
Target creature gets +0/+4 until end of turn.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Karmic Guide
cards.text:
Flying, protection from black
Echo {3}{W}{W} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Karmic Guide enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.original_text:
Flying, protection from black; echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
When Karmic Guide comes into play, choose target creature card in your graveyard and put that creature into play.

cards.name: Knighthood
cards.text: Creatures you control have first strike.
cards.flavor:
"He has returned. He who brought the dark ones. He who poisoned our paradise. How shall we greet him? With swift and certain death!"
—Radiant, archangel
cards.original_text: All creatures you control gain first strike.

cards.name: Martyr's Cause
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to any target this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.flavor: Dying is a soldier's talent.
cards.original_text: Sacrifice a creature: Prevent all damage to a creature or player from one source. (Treat further damage from that source normally.)

cards.name: Mother of Runes
cards.text: {T}: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "My family protects all families."
cards.original_text: {T}: Target creature you control gains protection from a color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Opal Avenger
cards.text: When you have 10 or less life, if Opal Avenger is an enchantment, Opal Avenger becomes a 3/5 Soldier creature.
cards.flavor: As the sun grew cold in the realm, the statue grew warm.
cards.original_text: When you have 10 life or less, if Opal Avenger is an enchantment, Opal Avenger becomes a 3/5 creature that counts as a Guardian.

rulings.text: When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.name: Opal Champion
cards.text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Champion is an enchantment, Opal Champion becomes a 3/3 Knight creature with first strike.
cards.original_text: When one of your opponents successfully casts a creature spell, if Opal Champion is an enchantment, Opal Champion becomes a 3/3 creature with first strike that counts as a Knight.

rulings.text: It triggers when the spell is cast, so it becomes a creature before the spell resolves. A creature that would destroy an enchantment when it enters the battlefield can't be used to destroy this card, since it will no longer be an enchantment when the creature enters the battlefield.
When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.
It changes into a creature even if the spell is countered.
A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.name: Peace and Quiet
cards.text: Destroy two target enchantments.
cards.flavor:
"In time our realm will shine again. But it will gleam only when we scour away the taint of doubt."
—Radiant, archangel
cards.original_text: Destroy two target enchantments.

rulings.text: Must target two different enchantments.

cards.name: Planar Collapse
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are four or more creatures on the battlefield, sacrifice Planar Collapse and destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: With heavy heart, Urza doused one world's light to rekindle another's.
cards.original_text: During your upkeep, if there are four or more creatures in play, sacrifice Planar Collapse and destroy all creatures. Those creatures cannot be regenerated this turn.

rulings.text: This ability does not trigger at all if there are not 4 or more creatures on the battlefield. It also checks this at the start of resolution and does nothing if this is not still true.
The ability is not optional.
If this card is not on the battlefield when the ability resolves, then you can't sacrifice it. However, you still destroy all creatures.

cards.name: Purify
cards.text: Destroy all artifacts and enchantments.
cards.flavor:
"Our Mother! The sky was Her hair; the sun, Her face. She danced on the grass and in the hills."
—Song of All, canto 23
cards.original_text: Destroy all artifacts and enchantments.

cards.name: Radiant, Archangel
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
Radiant, Archangel gets +1/+1 for each other creature with flying on the battlefield.
cards.original_text:
Flying
Radiant, Archangel counts as an Angel.
Attacking does not cause Radiant to tap.
Radiant gets +1/+1 for each other creature with flying in play.

cards.name: Radiant's Dragoons
cards.text:
Echo {3}{W} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Radiant's Dragoons enters the battlefield, you gain 5 life.
cards.original_text:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
When Radiant's Dragoons comes into play, gain 5 life.

cards.name: Radiant's Judgment
cards.text:
Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.original_text:
Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Sustainer of the Realm
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Sustainer of the Realm blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The harder you push, the stronger we become."
—Radiant, to Urza
cards.original_text:
Flying
Whenever Sustainer of the Realm blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

rulings.text: It gets the bonus only once, not once per creature it blocks.

cards.name: Tragic Poet
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Tragic Poet: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "I would weep, but my tears have been stolen; I would shout, but my voice has been taken. Thus, I write."
cards.original_text: {T}, Sacrifice Tragic Poet: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Anthroplasm
cards.text:
Anthroplasm enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{X}, {T}: Remove all +1/+1 counters from Anthroplasm and put X +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.flavor: I never metamorphosis I didn't like.
cards.original_text:
Anthroplasm comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{X}, {T}: Remove all +1/+1 counters from Anthroplasm and put X +1/+1 counters on it.

rulings.text: While Anthroplasm does become 0/0 for a moment while its ability resolves, state-based actions are not checked until the ability has finished resolving. By that time, it will have some +1/+1 counters on it (assuming X was greater than 0), and so will not be put into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Archivist
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Some do. Some teach. The rest look it up.
cards.original_text: {T}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Aura Flux
cards.text: Other enchantments have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this enchantment unless you pay {2}."
cards.flavor: To some, the Tolarian sunrise was a blinding flash; to others, a lingering glow.
cards.original_text: Each other enchantment gains "During your upkeep, pay {2} or sacrifice this enchantment."

rulings.text: If two or more Aura Fluxes are on the battlefield, they will give the text to each other. And they will cause each other enchantment to have two triggered abilities for which the player would have to pay.
This card adds a triggered ability to all other enchantments.
You choose whether to pay {2} or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice the enchantment.

cards.name: Bouncing Beebles
cards.text: Bouncing Beebles can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an artifact.
cards.flavor: Beebles are frequently hurled against stone surfaces at high speed but always zing back into the air with a giggle.
cards.original_text: Bouncing Beebles is unblockable if defending player controls an artifact.

cards.name: Cloud of Faeries
cards.text:
Flying
When Cloud of Faeries enters the battlefield, untap up to two lands.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Cloud of Faeries comes into play, untap up to two lands.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: You can untap 0, 1, or 2 lands.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You choose which lands to untap as the triggered ability resolves. They aren't targeted, and they don't have to be lands that you control.

cards.name: Delusions of Mediocrity
cards.text:
When Delusions of Mediocrity enters the battlefield, you gain 10 life.
When Delusions of Mediocrity leaves the battlefield, you lose 10 life.
cards.flavor: When nothing but second best will do.
cards.original_text:
When Delusions of Mediocrity comes into play, gain 10 life.
When Delusions of Mediocrity leaves play, lose 10 life.

cards.name: Fleeting Image
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Return Fleeting Image to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Horas swore off drinking, but after meeting the creature a second time he decided he'd better start again.
cards.original_text:
Flying
{1}{U}: Return Fleeting Image to owner's hand.

cards.name: Frantic Search
cards.text: Draw two cards, then discard two cards. Untap up to three lands.
cards.flavor: Motivation was high in the academy once students realized flunking their exams could kill them.
cards.original_text: Draw two cards, then choose and discard two cards. Untap up to three lands.

rulings.text: You choose which lands to untap as the triggered ability resolves. They aren't targeted, and they don't have to be lands that you control.

cards.name: Intervene
cards.text: Counter target spell that targets a creature.
cards.flavor:
"At first I simply observed. But I found that without investment in others, life serves no purpose."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.original_text: Counter target spell that targets a creature.

rulings.text: If a spell is modal, use the target(s) of the current mode only for this check. Targets for the other modes are never selected.
Intervene can only target a spell that is currently targeting a creature.
It means "targeting at least one creature" not "exactly one creature".
If the spell's target leaves the battlefield before this spell resolves, Intervene won't resolve since it no longer targets a spell that targets a creature.

cards.name: King Crab
cards.text: {1}{U}, {T}: Put target green creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"I'm allergic to shellfish—not only did it kill my entire village, it also gave me this nasty rash."
—Olivia, fisher
cards.original_text: {1}{U}, {T}: Put target green creature on top of owner's library.

cards.name: Levitation
cards.text: Creatures you control have flying.
cards.flavor: Barrin's pride in his apprentice was diminished somewhat when he had to get the others back down.
cards.original_text: All creatures you control gain flying.

cards.name: Miscalculation
cards.text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.original_text:
Counter target spell unless its caster pays an additional {2}.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Opportunity
cards.text: Target player draws four cards.
cards.flavor:
"He cocooned himself alone in his workshop for months. When he finally emerged, all broad grins and excited chatter, I knew he'd found his answer."
—Barrin, master wizard
cards.original_text: Target player draws four cards.

cards.name: Palinchron
cards.text:
Flying
When Palinchron enters the battlefield, untap up to seven lands.
{2}{U}{U}: Return Palinchron to its owner's hand.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Palinchron comes into play, untap up to seven lands.
{2}{U}{U}: Return Palinchron to owner's hand.

rulings.text: You can untap 0 to 7 lands.
You choose which lands to untap as the triggered ability resolves. They aren't targeted, and they don't have to be lands that you control.

cards.name: Raven Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
Echo {2}{U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Raven Familiar enters the battlefield, look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.original_text:
Flying; echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
When Raven Familiar comes into play, look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: This is not a draw.

cards.name: Rebuild
cards.text:
Return all artifacts to their owners' hands.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.original_text:
Return all artifacts to owners' hands.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Remember that cards only affect things which are on the battlefield unless they specifically say otherwise. So this only applies to artifacts on the battlefield.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Second Chance
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 5 or less life, sacrifice Second Chance and take an extra turn after this one.
cards.flavor: The greatest gift is the opportunity to right one's wrongs.
cards.original_text: During your upkeep, if you have 5 life or less, sacrifice Second Chance and take an extra turn after this one.

rulings.text: It is not optional.
The ability will only trigger if you have 5 or less life at the beginning of upkeep. This is checked again at the start of resolution and nothing happens if you do not still have 5 or less life.
If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

On resolution of the trigger you have to sacrifice this card if you have 5 life or less. If you can't (because it is not on the battlefield, for example), then you still take an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Slow Motion
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player sacrifices that creature unless they pay {2}.
When Slow Motion is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Slow Motion to its owner's hand.
cards.original_text:
During the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player pays {2} or sacrifices that creature.
When Slow Motion is put into a graveyard from play, return Slow Motion to owner's hand.

rulings.text: You choose whether to pay or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice the creature. You can choose to not pay if you no longer control the creature on resolution.

cards.name: Snap
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Untap up to two lands.
cards.flavor: Good riddance.
cards.original_text: Return target creature to owner's hand. Untap up to two lands.

rulings.text: You can untap 0, 1, or 2 lands.
You choose which lands to untap as the triggered ability resolves. They aren't targeted, and they don't have to be lands that you control.

cards.name: Thornwind Faeries
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Thornwind Faeries deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Guarding the ship is the Thornwinds' first concern. Getting along with the locals ranks fourth or fifth at best.
cards.original_text:
Flying
{T}: Thornwind Faeries deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Tinker
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact.
Search your library for an artifact card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"I wonder how it feels to be bored."
—Jhoira, artificer
cards.original_text:
At the time you play Tinker, sacrifice an artifact.
Search your library for an artifact card and put that artifact into play. Shuffle your library afterward.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.name: Vigilant Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{U}: Untap Vigilant Drake.
cards.flavor: Awake and awing in the blink of an eye.
cards.original_text:
Flying
{2}{U}: Untap Vigilant Drake.

cards.name: Walking Sponge
cards.text: {T}: Target creature loses your choice of flying, first strike, or trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Not only does it catch fish, it cleans them too.
cards.original_text: {T}: Target creature loses flying, first strike, or trample until end of turn.

rulings.text: The target loses just one of the listed abilities.

cards.name: Weatherseed Faeries
cards.text: Flying, protection from red
cards.flavor: Two days after the forge was completed, the faeries were immune to its flames.
cards.original_text: Flying, protection from red

cards.name: Bone Shredder
cards.text:
Flying
Echo {2}{B} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Bone Shredder enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature.
cards.original_text: Flying; echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.) When Bone Shredder comes into play, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature.

cards.name: Brink of Madness
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have no cards in hand, sacrifice Brink of Madness and target opponent discards their hand.
cards.flavor:
"The fools thought me dead. But I built an empire inside my tomb."
—Kerrick, sleeper agent
cards.original_text: During your upkeep, if you have no cards in hand, sacrifice Brink of Madness and target opponent discards his or her hand.

rulings.text: The ability only triggers if you have no cards in your hand as your upkeep step begins.

You must sacrifice Brink of Madness if possible, but the opponent discards their hand even if you can't sacrifice it for some reason (for example, if it were returned to its owner's hand before the ability resolved).

cards.name: Engineered Plague
cards.text:
As Engineered Plague enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
All creatures of the chosen type get -1/-1.
cards.flavor:
"The admixture of bitterwort in the viral brew has produced most favorable results."
—Phyrexian progress notes
cards.original_text:
When Engineered Plague comes into play, choose a creature type.
All creatures of the chosen type get -1/-1.

cards.name: Eviscerator
cards.text:
Protection from white
When Eviscerator enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.
cards.flavor: It roamed the time bubble like a captured animal. Kerrick knew he must soon find a way to unleash it on Tolaria or destroy it.
cards.original_text:
Protection from white
When Eviscerator comes into play, lose 5 life.

rulings.text: This is loss of life, and not damage. It can't be prevented.

cards.name: Fog of Gnats
cards.text:
Flying
{B}: Regenerate Fog of Gnats.
cards.flavor: You can swat a thousand gnats, but a thousand more will assail you.
cards.original_text:
Flying
{B}: Regenerate Fog of Gnats.

cards.name: Giant Cockroach
cards.flavor: If the sun ever hit the swamp, where would these scurry to?

cards.name: Lurking Skirge
cards.text: When a creature is put into an opponent's graveyard from the battlefield, if Lurking Skirge is an enchantment, Lurking Skirge becomes a 3/2 Imp creature with flying.
cards.flavor: They never miss a funeral.
cards.original_text: When a creature is put into one of your opponents' graveyards, if Lurking Skirge is an enchantment, Lurking Skirge becomes a 3/2 creature with flying that counts as an Imp.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.name: No Mercy
cards.text: Whenever a creature deals damage to you, destroy it.
cards.flavor:
"We had years to prepare, while they had mere minutes."
—Kerrick, sleeper agent
cards.original_text: Whenever a creature successfully deals damage to you, destroy it.

rulings.text: If the damage to you is all prevented or redirected, then damage was not dealt to you, and this does not trigger.

cards.name: Ostracize
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a creature card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: Kerrick was to find that some borders can never be crossed.
cards.original_text: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a creature card there. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Phyrexian Broodlings
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Phyrexian Broodlings.
cards.flavor: With limited resources and near unlimited time, Kerrick used parts from one beast to build another.
cards.original_text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Phyrexian Broodlings.

cards.name: Phyrexian Debaser
cards.text:
Flying
{T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Debaser: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The second stage of the illness: high fever and severe infectiousness."
—Phyrexian progress notes
cards.original_text:
Flying
{T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Debaser: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Phyrexian Defiler
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Defiler: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The third stage of the illness: muscle aches and persistent cough."
—Phyrexian progress notes
cards.original_text: {T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Defiler: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Phyrexian Denouncer
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Denouncer: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The first stage of the illness: rash and nausea."
—Phyrexian progress notes
cards.original_text: {T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Denouncer: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Phyrexian Plaguelord
cards.text:
{T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Plaguelord: Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The final stage of the illness: delirium, convulsions, and death."
—Phyrexian progress notes
cards.original_text:
{T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Plaguelord: Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Phyrexian Reclamation
cards.text: {1}{B}, Pay 2 life: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Death is no excuse to stop working.
cards.original_text: {1}{B}, Pay 2 life: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Plague Beetle
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: It is the harbinger of disease, not the carrier.
cards.original_text: Swampwalk (If defending player controls a swamp, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Rank and File
cards.text: When Rank and File enters the battlefield, green creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Left, right, left, right . . . hmm. Okay—left, left, left, left, . . ."
cards.original_text: When Rank and File comes into play, all green creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: The -1/-1 penalty is given to all green creatures on the battlefield when the triggered ability resolves. It will not apply to green creatures that enter the battlefield later in the turn.

cards.name: Sick and Tired
cards.text: Two target creatures each get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The Phyrexians' only interest in organic life is discerning its weakness.
cards.original_text: Two target creatures each get -1/-1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Must target two different creatures.

cards.name: Sleeper's Guile
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
When Sleeper's Guile is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Sleeper's Guile to its owner's hand.
cards.original_text:
Enchanted creature cannot be blocked except by artifact creatures and black creatures.
When Sleeper's Guile is put into a graveyard from play, return Sleeper's Guile to owner's hand.

cards.name: Subversion
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent loses 1 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.
cards.flavor: Kerrick's corrupt domain swelled like a blister on Tolaria's skin.
cards.original_text: During your upkeep, each of your opponents loses 1 life. Gain 1 life for each 1 life lost this way.

rulings.text: This is loss of life, not damage. It can't be prevented.

cards.name: Swat
cards.text:
Destroy target creature with power 2 or less.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.original_text:
Destroy target creature with power 2 or less.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Tethered Skirge
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Tethered Skirge becomes the target of a spell or ability, you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: It bites the hand that leads it.
cards.original_text:
Flying
Whenever Tethered Skirge becomes the target of a spell or ability, lose 1 life.

cards.name: Treacherous Link
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature is dealt to its controller instead.
cards.flavor:
"You cannot possibly know the toll your alliances will exact from you."
—Barrin, to Urza
cards.original_text: Redirect to its controller all damage dealt to enchanted creature.

cards.name: Unearth
cards.text:
Return target creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.original_text:
Choose target creature card in your graveyard with total casting cost 3 or less and put that creature into play.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: About Face
cards.text: Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The overconfident are the most vulnerable.
cards.original_text: Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn. Effects that alter the creature's power alter its toughness instead, and vice versa, this turn.

rulings.text: Note that the wording "Effects that alter the creature's power alter its toughness instead, and vice versa, this turn" has been removed.
Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
Switching a creature's power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

cards.name: Avalanche Riders
cards.text:
Haste
Echo {3}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Avalanche Riders enters the battlefield, destroy target land.
cards.original_text:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
Avalanche Riders is unaffected by summoning sickness.
When Avalanche Riders comes into play, destroy target land.

cards.name: Defender of Chaos
cards.text:
Flash
Protection from white
cards.flavor: Some knights will not follow orders—only disorder.
cards.original_text:
Protection from white
You may play Defender of Chaos any time you could play an instant.

rulings.text: This card is always a creature spell and is never an instant spell, no matter when you cast it.

cards.name: Ghitu Fire-Eater
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Ghitu Fire-Eater: It deals damage equal to its power to any target.
cards.flavor:
"They are called 'Mi'uto,' which means 'one use.'"
—Jhoira, artificer
cards.original_text: {T}, Sacrifice Ghitu Fire-Eater: Ghitu Fire-Eater deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

cards.name: Ghitu Slinger
cards.text:
Echo {2}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Ghitu Slinger enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: If you survive a slinger attack, the slinger wished you to live.
cards.original_text:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
When Ghitu Slinger comes into play, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Ghitu War Cry
cards.text: {R}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The war cry is not simply a shout but a sacrament.
cards.original_text: {R}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Medics
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Medics becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"First, do some harm."
—Oath of Goblins
cards.original_text: Whenever Goblin Medics becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: The ability does trigger when it taps to attack.

cards.name: Goblin Welder
cards.text: {T}: Choose target artifact a player controls and target artifact card in that player's graveyard. If both targets are still legal as this ability resolves, that player simultaneously sacrifices the artifact and returns the artifact card to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "I wrecked your metal guy, boss. But look! I made you an ashtray."
cards.original_text: {T}: Exchange target artifact a player controls for target artifact card in that player's graveyard.

rulings.text: As the new wording makes clear, both targets must still be legal as the ability resolves in order for it to do anything. If either one or both has become illegal, nothing gets sacrificed and nothing gets returned to the battlefield.

cards.name: Granite Grip
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each Mountain you control.
cards.flavor: There's beauty in the desert—but it's best to view it from afar.
cards.original_text: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each mountain you control.

cards.name: Impending Disaster
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are seven or more lands on the battlefield, sacrifice Impending Disaster and destroy all lands.
cards.flavor:
"The goblins are in charge of maintenance? Why not just set it on fire now and call it a day?"
—Whip Tongue, viashino technician
cards.original_text: During your upkeep, if there are seven or more lands in play, sacrifice Impending Disaster and destroy all lands.

rulings.text: This ability does not trigger at all if there are not seven lands on the battlefield at the beginning of upkeep. It checks this number again when it is going to resolve and does not do anything if the land count is below 7.
The ability is not optional.
If this card is not on the battlefield at the times its ability resolves, then you can't sacrifice it. However, you still destroy all lands.

cards.name: Last-Ditch Effort
cards.text: Sacrifice any number of creatures. Last-Ditch Effort deals that much damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"If you're gonna lose, at least make sure they don't win as much."
—Jula, goblin raider
cards.original_text: Sacrifice X creatures. Last-Ditch Effort deals X damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: The creatures are chosen and sacrificed on resolution.
It deals one damage for each creature sacrificed.

cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: "Catch!"
cards.original_text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.

cards.name: Molten Hydra
cards.text:
{1}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Molten Hydra.
{T}, Remove all +1/+1 counters from Molten Hydra: Molten Hydra deals damage to any target equal to the number of +1/+1 counters removed this way.
cards.flavor: Keep off the glass. —Hydra warning sign
cards.original_text:
{1}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Molten Hydra.
{T}, Remove all +1/+1 counters from Molten Hydra: Molten Hydra deals 1 damage to target creature or player for each +1/+1 counter removed this way.

cards.name: Parch
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Parch deals 2 damage to any target.
• Parch deals 4 damage to target blue creature.
cards.flavor:
"Your porous flesh betrays you."
—Fire Eye, viashino bey
cards.original_text: Choose one Parch deals 2 damage to target creature or player; or Parch deals 4 damage to target blue creature.

rulings.text: You choose the mode when you announce the spell.
You can choose to use the 2 damage mode on a blue creature if you want.

cards.name: Pygmy Pyrosaur
cards.text:
Pygmy Pyrosaur can't block.
{R}: Pygmy Pyrosaur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
Do not judge a lizard by its size.
—Ghitu proverb
cards.original_text:
Pygmy Pyrosaur cannot block.
{R}: Pygmy Pyrosaur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Pyromancy
cards.text: {3}, Discard a card at random: Pyromancy deals damage to any target equal to the converted mana cost of the discarded card.
cards.flavor:
Who harnesses fire controls the world.
—Ghitu proverb
cards.original_text: {3}, Discard a card at random: Pyromancy deals to target creature or player damage equal to the total casting cost of the discarded card.

rulings.text: A card with X in the cost is treated as X=0.
You pick the target before you know which card is going to be discarded.

cards.name: Rack and Ruin
cards.text: Destroy two target artifacts.
cards.flavor:
"My people are bound by masters centuries dead. Each artifact we destroy is another link broken in that chain."
—Barb Tail, viashino heretic
cards.original_text: Destroy two target artifacts.

rulings.text: Must target two different artifacts.

cards.name: Rivalry
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if that player controls more lands than each other player, Rivalry deals 2 damage to them.
cards.flavor: The goblins revered it; the viashino defended it. Only Urza understood it.
cards.original_text: During each player's upkeep, if that player controls more lands than any other, Rivalry deals 2 damage to him or her.

rulings.text: This ability will only trigger if the player controls more lands at the beginning of upkeep. This condition is checked again at the start of resolution, and if not true, then nothing happens.

cards.name: Shivan Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying
When Shivan Phoenix dies, return Shivan Phoenix to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: To strike down the phoenix is to slash at the flame.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Shivan Phoenix is put into a graveyard from play, return Shivan Phoenix to owner's hand.

cards.name: Sluggishness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't block.
When Sluggishness is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Sluggishness to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Vark decided to lie down and think of a good excuse to quit working.
cards.original_text:
Enchanted creature cannot block.
When Sluggishness is put into a graveyard from play, return Sluggishness to owner's hand.

cards.name: Viashino Bey
cards.text: If Viashino Bey attacks, all creatures you control attack if able.
cards.flavor:
When the bey runs, match his stride.
—Viashino saying
cards.original_text: When Viashino Bey attacks, all creatures you control attack if able.

rulings.text: The ability is not a triggered ability. It is a constraint on declaring an attack.

cards.name: Viashino Cutthroat
cards.text:
Haste
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Cutthroat to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"You guys go on ahead. I'll catch up with ya."
—Vark, goblin scout, last words
cards.original_text:
Viashino Cutthroat is unaffected by summoning sickness.
At end of turn, return Viashino Cutthroat to owner's hand.

rulings.text: It is returned to its owner's hand at the end of turn only if it is on the battlefield.

cards.name: Viashino Heretic
cards.text: {1}{R}, {T}: Destroy target artifact. Viashino Heretic deals damage to that artifact's controller equal to the artifact's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: "The past is buried for good reason."
cards.original_text: {1}{R}, {T}: Destroy target artifact. Viashino Heretic deals to that artifact's controller damage equal to the artifact's total casting cost.

cards.name: Viashino Sandscout
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandscout to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
cards.original_text:
Viashino Sandscout is unaffected by summoning sickness.
At end of turn, return Viashino Sandscout to owner's hand.

rulings.text: It is returned to its owner's hand at the end of turn only if it is on the battlefield.

cards.name: Bloated Toad
cards.text:
Protection from blue
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.original_text:
Protection from blue
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Crop Rotation
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for a land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "Hmm . . . maybe lotuses this year."
cards.original_text:
At the time you play Crop Rotation, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for a land card and put that land into play. Shuffle your library afterward.

cards.name: Darkwatch Elves
cards.text:
Protection from black
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.original_text:
Protection from black
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Defense of the Heart
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls three or more creatures, sacrifice Defense of the Heart, search your library for up to two creature cards, and put those cards onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.original_text: During your upkeep, if one of your opponents controls three or more creatures, sacrifice Defense of the Heart, search your library for up to two creature cards, and put those creatures into play. Shuffle your library afterward.

rulings.text: In a multiplayer game, it triggers if at least one opponent controls three or more creatures.
You choose how many cards to put onto the battlefield during the resolution after you look through your library. You do not choose as the ability goes on the stack.
This triggered ability only triggers if your opponent controls 3 or more creatures at the beginning of upkeep. This condition is checked again on resolution.
If this card is not on the battlefield at the time it resolves, then you can't sacrifice it. You still perform the search and put any creature cards you find onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Deranged Hermit
cards.text:
Echo {3}{G}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Deranged Hermit enters the battlefield, create four 1/1 green Squirrel creature tokens.
Squirrel creatures get +1/+1.
cards.original_text:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
When Deranged Hermit comes into play, put four Squirrel tokens into play. Treat these tokens as 1/1 green creatures.
All Squirrels get +1/+1.

rulings.text: The Squirrel tokens get the bonus, so they are effectively 2/2 creatures until the Hermit leaves the battlefield. And they get bigger if multiple Hermits are on the battlefield.

cards.name: Gang of Elk
cards.text: Whenever Gang of Elk becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
cards.flavor: The elk is Gaea's favorite, who wears the forest on its brow.
cards.original_text: Whenever a creature blocks it, Gang of Elk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Gang of Elk gets the bonus once for each blocker.

cards.name: Harmonic Convergence
cards.text: Put all enchantments on top of their owners' libraries.
cards.flavor: When the eternal stars align, can mere mortals resist?
cards.original_text: Return all enchantments to top of owners' libraries.

rulings.text: If any player needs to put more than one enchantment on top of their library, they choose the order.

cards.name: Hidden Gibbons
cards.text: When an opponent casts an instant spell, if Hidden Gibbons is an enchantment, Hidden Gibbons becomes a 4/4 Ape creature.
cards.flavor: When these apes want something, it's a matter of gibbon take.
cards.original_text: When one of your opponents successfully casts an instant or interrupt spell, if Hidden Gibbons is an enchantment, Hidden Gibbons becomes a 4/4 creature that counts as an Ape.

rulings.text: When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.
It changes into a creature even if the spell is countered.
The ability triggers when the spell is cast, so it becomes a creature before the spell resolves.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.name: Lone Wolf
cards.text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
cards.flavor: A wolf without a pack is either a survivor or a brute.
cards.original_text: You may have Lone Wolf deal combat damage to defending player instead of to creatures blocking it.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.name: Might of Oaks
cards.text: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Suddenly, she couldn't see the acorns for the trees.
cards.original_text: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.name: Multani, Maro-Sorcerer
cards.text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Multani, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the total number of cards in all players' hands.
cards.flavor:
"To make peace with the forest, make peace with me."
—Multani, to Urza
cards.original_text:
Multani, Maro-Sorcerer has power and toughness each equal to the total number of cards in all players' hands.
Multani cannot be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Multani's Acolyte
cards.text:
Echo {G}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Multani's Acolyte enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.original_text:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
When Multani's Acolyte comes into play, draw a card.

cards.name: Multani's Presence
cards.text: Whenever a spell you've cast is countered, draw a card.
cards.flavor: When a tree falls in the forest, Multani hears it.
cards.original_text: Whenever a spell you play is countered, draw a card.

rulings.text: A spell that doesn't resolve because its targets are illegal isn't countered, so this ability won't trigger. This is a change from previous rules.

cards.name: Rancor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has trample.
When Rancor is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Rancor to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Hatred outlives the hateful.
cards.original_text:
Enchanted creature gains +2/+0 and trample.
When Rancor is put into a graveyard from play, return Rancor to owner's hand.

rulings.text: If the creature this Aura would enchant is an illegal target by the time Rancor tries to resolve, the Aura spell doesn't resolve. It won't enter the battlefield, so it won't be put into a graveyard from the battlefield and its ability won't trigger.

cards.name: Repopulate
cards.text:
Shuffle all creature cards from target player's graveyard into that player's library.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.original_text:
Shuffle all creature cards from target player's graveyard into that player's library.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Silk Net
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: Sometimes it's possible to pull a meal out of thin air.
cards.original_text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and can block creatures with flying until end of turn.

rulings.text: Both the +1/+1 and reach only last until end of turn.
This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.name: Simian Grunts
cards.text:
Flash
Echo {2}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.flavor: These monkeys mean business.
cards.original_text:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
You may play Simian Grunts any time you could play an instant.

rulings.text: This card is always a creature spell and is never an instant spell, no matter when you cast it.

cards.name: Treefolk Mystic
cards.text: Whenever Treefolk Mystic blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy all Auras attached to that creature.
cards.flavor: Urza's wards fell from him like autumn leaves as he entered the dreaming grove. He awoke imprisoned in living wood.
cards.original_text: Whenever a creature blocks or is blocked by Treefolk Mystic, destroy all enchantments on that creature.

cards.name: Weatherseed Elf
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: "My grandmother once told me the future of our world was inside the Weatherseed. When I touched it, I knew she was right."
cards.original_text: {T}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn. (If defending player controls a forest, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Weatherseed Treefolk
cards.text:
Trample
When Weatherseed Treefolk dies, return it to its owner's hand.
cards.original_text:
Trample
When Weatherseed Treefolk is put into a graveyard from play, return Weatherseed Treefolk to owner's hand.

cards.name: Wing Snare
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Argoth's doom rained from a clear sky. Yavimaya will not share that fate."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer
cards.original_text: Destroy target creature with flying.

cards.name: Yavimaya Granger
cards.text:
Echo {2}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Yavimaya Granger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
cards.original_text:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
When Yavimaya Granger comes into play, you may search your library for a basic land card and put that land into play tapped. Shuffle your library afterward.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.name: Yavimaya Scion
cards.text: Protection from artifacts
cards.flavor: Each time the saw blade bit, the tree spat it out.
cards.original_text: Protection from artifacts

cards.name: Yavimaya Wurm
cards.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.flavor: When the gorilla playfully grabbed the wurm's tail, the wurm doubled back and playfully ate the gorilla's head.
cards.original_text: Trample

cards.name: Angel's Trumpet
cards.text:
All creatures have vigilance.
At the beginning of each player's end step, tap all untapped creatures that player controls that didn't attack this turn. Angel's Trumpet deals damage to the player equal to the number of creatures tapped this way.
cards.original_text:
Attacking does not cause creatures to tap.
At the end of each player's turn, tap all untapped creatures he or she controls that did not attack this turn. Angel's Trumpet deals 1 damage to that player for each creature tapped this way.

rulings.text: Angel's Trumpet affects creatures with Defender and other creatures that can't attack for some reason.
It does not affect creatures which did not attack, but which are already tapped at the time the ability resolves.

cards.name: Beast of Burden
cards.text: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "If it is meant to be nothing but a machine," Karn finally asked Jhoira, "why did Urza build it to be like me?"
cards.original_text: Beast of Burden has power and toughness each equal to the total number of creatures in play.

cards.name: Crawlspace
cards.text: No more than two creatures can attack you each combat.
cards.flavor: The goblins did not understand their attraction to the mana rig. They simply knew it was where they belonged.
cards.original_text: No more than two creatures can attack you each combat.

rulings.text: Your opponents can still attack planeswalkers you control with any number of creatures each combat.

cards.name: Damping Engine
cards.text: A player who controls more permanents than each other player can't play lands or cast artifact, creature, or enchantment spells. That player may sacrifice a permanent for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.
cards.original_text: A player who controls more permanents than any other cannot play lands or artifact, creature, or enchantment spells. That player may sacrifice a permanent to ignore this effect until end of turn.

rulings.text: A player affected by this card can sacrifice a permanent any time they could cast an instant. This is a special action that doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.

A player can only sacrifice a permanent to end this effect if they have more permanents than any other player, and they haven't already sacrificed a permanent to end the effect this turn. The ability to sacrifice a creature is granted by the same effect that is being ended.

cards.name: Defense Grid
cards.text: Each spell costs {3} more to cast except during its controller's turn.
cards.flavor:
"We've managed to keep the goblins in their assigned areas, but there's little we can do about the smell."
—Whip Tongue, viashino technician
cards.original_text: During each player's turn, spells played by another player cost an additional {3}.

rulings.text: The additional cost can be reduced by effects that reduce costs, such as Sapphire Medallion.
In Two-Headed Giant, spells don't cost extra on your own turn.

cards.name: Grim Monolith
cards.text:
Grim Monolith doesn't untap during your untap step.
{T}: Add {C}{C}{C}.
{4}: Untap Grim Monolith.
cards.flavor: Part prison, part home.
cards.original_text:
Grim Monolith does not untap during your untap phase.
{T}: Add three colorless mana to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.
{4}: Untap Grim Monolith.

cards.name: Iron Maiden
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Iron Maiden deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in their hand minus 4.
cards.flavor: The maiden is a jealous lover.
cards.original_text: During each of your opponent's upkeeps, Iron Maiden deals 1 damage to that player for each card more than four in his or her hand.

cards.name: Jhoira's Toolbox
cards.text: {2}: Regenerate target artifact creature.
cards.flavor: It entertained Jhoira to craft a kit that could bring her the tools.
cards.original_text: {2}: Regenerate target artifact creature.

cards.name: Memory Jar
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Memory Jar: Each player exiles all cards from their hand face down and draws seven cards. At the beginning of the next end step, each player discards their hand and returns to their hand each card they exiled this way.
cards.original_text: {T}, Sacrifice Memory Jar: Each player sets aside his or her hand, face down, and draws seven cards. At end of turn, each player discards his or her hand and returns to his or her hand each card he or she set aside this way.

rulings.text: You can't look at the cards you exiled until they return to your hand.

cards.name: Quicksilver Amulet
cards.text: {4}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Wonderful! You got a lion on your first try. Now put it back."
cards.original_text: {4}, {T}: Choose a creature card in your hand and put that creature into play.

rulings.text: Any 'X' in the creature's cost is treated as zero.
Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.
You don't pay any costs of that creature card, including additional costs.

cards.name: Ring of Gix
cards.text:
Echo {3} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
{1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor: Not every cage is made of bars.
cards.original_text:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
{1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Scrapheap
cards.text: Whenever an artifact or enchantment is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Junk heaps have rats, but scrapheaps have goblins.
cards.original_text: Whenever an artifact or enchantment is put into your graveyard from play, gain 1 life.

cards.name: Thran Lens
cards.text: All permanents are colorless.
cards.flavor:
"Every device in the rig is evidence of Thran enlightenment. All mana was the same to them, whether from rock or water, growth or decay. Can you imagine such unity of vision?"
—Urza, journal
cards.original_text: All permanents are colorless.

rulings.text: Does not make the permanents into artifacts. They are simply without color.
Does not prevent a spell or ability from adding color to permanents after this effect is applied.

cards.name: Thran War Machine
cards.text:
Echo {4} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
Thran War Machine attacks each combat if able.
cards.original_text:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
Thran War Machine attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Thran Weaponry
cards.text:
Echo {4} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
You may choose not to untap Thran Weaponry during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: All creatures get +2/+2 for as long as Thran Weaponry remains tapped.
cards.original_text:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
You may choose not to untap Thran Weaponry during your untap phase.
{2}, {T}: All creatures get +2/+2 as long as Thran Weaponry remains tapped.

cards.name: Ticking Gnomes
cards.text:
Echo {3} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
Sacrifice Ticking Gnomes: It deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.original_text:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
Sacrifice Ticking Gnomes: Ticking Gnomes deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Urza's Blueprints
cards.text:
Echo {6} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
{T}: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: From concept to paper to reality.
cards.original_text:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
{T}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Wheel of Torture
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Wheel of Torture deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in their hand.
cards.flavor: "I'd like to buy a bowel."
cards.original_text: During each of your opponents' upkeeps, Wheel of Torture deals 1 damage to that player for each card fewer than three in his or her hand.

rulings.text: The number of cards is counted during resolution.

cards.name: Faerie Conclave
cards.text:
Faerie Conclave enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U}.
{1}{U}: Faerie Conclave becomes a 2/1 blue Faerie creature with flying until end of turn. It's still a land.
cards.original_text:
Faerie Conclave comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one blue mana to your mana pool.
{1}{U}: Faerie Conclave becomes a 2/1 blue creature with flying until end of turn. This creature still counts as a land.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.name: Forbidding Watchtower
cards.text:
Forbidding Watchtower enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W}.
{1}{W}: Forbidding Watchtower becomes a 1/5 white Soldier creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
cards.original_text:
Forbidding Watchtower comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one white mana to your mana pool.
{1}{W}: Forbidding Watchtower becomes a 1/5 white creature until end of turn. This creature still counts as a land.

However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.name: Ghitu Encampment
cards.text:
Ghitu Encampment enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R}.
{1}{R}: Ghitu Encampment becomes a 2/1 red Warrior creature with first strike until end of turn. It's still a land. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.original_text:
Ghitu Encampment comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one red mana to your mana pool.
{1}{R}: Ghitu Encampment becomes a 2/1 red creature with first strike until end of turn. This creature still counts as a land.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.name: Spawning Pool
cards.text:
Spawning Pool enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B}.
{1}{B}: Spawning Pool becomes a 1/1 black Skeleton creature with "{B}: Regenerate this creature" until end of turn. It's still a land. (If it regenerates, the next time it would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.original_text:
Spawning Pool comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one black mana to your mana pool.
{1}{B}: Spawning Pool becomes a 1/1 black creature with "{B} Regenerate this creature" until end of turn. This creature still counts as a land.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.name: Treetop Village
cards.text:
Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.original_text:
Treetop Village comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one green mana to your mana pool.
{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green creature with trample until end of turn. This creature still counts as a land.
